item.title: Dance Event Application: Streamlining Dance Competition Management
item.description:
Dance Event Application: Revolutionizing Dance Competition Management 💃🕺

Project Overview

The Dance Event Application is the most comprehensive and collaborative project I’ve worked on, developed over four months by a six-member team. This project is a web-based dance event management system designed to address inefficiencies in managing dance competitions. The platform not only streamlines participant registration but also enhances competition management for organizers.

With over 14,000 users (parents, teachers, and organizers), this platform provides a unified, automated, and scalable solution for registering and managing dance competitions. From handling eligibility requirements to secure payment processing, this application meets the needs of diverse stakeholders in the dance competition ecosystem.

Confidentiality Notice: Due to a non-disclosure agreement (NDA) signed with our client, we cannot share the source code or sensitive project details. However, we are happy to share an overview of the system and its capabilities.

Key Features

1. User Roles and Permissions

  • Super Organizer:
    • Oversees all competitions, users, and permissions.
    • Manages requests from new organizers.
  • Organizer:
    • Creates and manages competitions, sets eligibility rules (e.g., age, group size).
  • Participant:
    • Registers individuals or groups for competitions.
    • Parents and teachers can manage registrations for their children or students.

2. Participant Registration

  • Allows individual or group-based registrations.
  • Automatically calculates age and group eligibility based on birthdates.

3. Competition Management

  • Organizers can:
    • Create and edit competitions.
    • Set custom rules for age ranges, participant limits, and group sizes.
    • Monitor and analyze registrations and seat availability.

4. Payment Integration

  • Secure multi-competition payment processing using Stripe.
  • Participants can add multiple competitions to a cart and pay in one transaction.

5. Data Analytics

  • Provides organizers with:
    • Insights into registration trends.
    • Data for planning and optimizing future events.

6. Automation and Scalability

  • Automates repetitive tasks like age calculation and eligibility checks.
  • Hosted on AWS to handle high registration volumes during peak times.

Demonstration

Here’s a short video showcasing the features and functionality of the Dance Event Application:

Technologies Used

Technology Purpose
React (18.2.0) Frontend development and user interface.
ASP.NET Core (8) Backend API development and business logic.
SQL Server (2022) Database management for structured data.
JWT Secure user authentication and authorization.
AWS Hosting and scalability (API Gateway, Amplify, Lambda).
Stripe Secure payment gateway integration.

System Architecture

The system uses a tiered architecture with the following components:

  1. Frontend (React): A user-friendly interface allowing participants and organizers to manage events and registrations.
  2. Backend (ASP.NET Core): A RESTful API layer for handling business logic, user authentication, and database operations.
  3. Database (SQL Server): Stores user, competition, and registration data.
  4. Authentication (JWT): Ensures secure access to APIs and user-specific data.
  5. Cloud Hosting (AWS): Provides reliability, scalability, and cost-effective infrastructure.

Database Schema

The following Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD) illustrates the database structure used in the Dance Event Application. It includes relationships between users, participants, groups, competitions, and registrations.

  • Users Table: Stores user information, including roles (Super Organizer, Organizer, Participant).
  • Persons Table: Contains data for individual participants (e.g., children or students).
  • Groups Table: Represents participant groups with calculated age ranges for eligibility.
  • Competitions Table: Holds information about dance competitions, including rules and schedules.
  • PersonCompetition & GroupCompetition Tables: Establish many-to-many relationships between participants/groups and competitions.

Development Journey

1. Planning and Requirement Gathering

  • Collaborated with the client to define functional requirements.
  • Created initial wireframes and system design.

2. Team Collaboration

  • A six-member team with clear role assignments:
    • Frontend: 3 members focused on UI/UX.
    • Backend: 3 members focused on API and database.
  • Weekly meetings to ensure smooth communication and progress tracking.

3. Challenges and Solutions

  • Concurrency Issues: Implemented database-level locks to prevent double bookings.
  • Scalability: Optimized database queries and used AWS services to handle high traffic.
  • Budget Constraints: Managed the project within the $200 AWS credit provided by the school.

4. Deployment

  • Successfully deployed the system on AWS, with a fully functional web interface for organizers and participants.

Planned Enhancements

  • Dance Video Uploads: Allow participants to submit videos for remote judging.
  • Mobile App: Expand accessibility by developing a companion mobile app.
  • Real-Time Notifications: Notify users about registration deadlines and updates.
  • Leaderboards: Add scoring and ranking features for competitions.

Acknowledgements

This project was made possible through:

  • Client Collaboration: For providing clear requirements and valuable feedback.
  • Educational Resources: Tutorials and documentation that guided us through complex challenges.
  • AWS Credit: A $200 AWS budget from the school enabled seamless hosting and deployment.

Contact and Demo

Although the AWS-hosted version has expired, we’d love to share a local demo or discuss the project in detail. Feel free to reach out!

  • Email: sunyike88@gmail.com

If you’d like to learn more about this project or see a demonstration, don’t hesitate to get in touch. This project showcases not only our technical skills but also our ability to work as a team and deliver real-world solutions.

item.title: ReStore: Showcasing My E-Commerce Project
item.description:
ReStore: Building an E-Commerce Platform from Scratch 🛒

Project Overview

ReStore is an ongoing e-commerce platform project that I am building to strengthen my skills in full-stack web development. This project showcases my ability to design and implement a functional, user-friendly online shopping website.

Currently, the project includes core features such as browsing products, adding items to the shopping cart, and viewing product details. While the basic structure is in place, there are additional functionalities I plan to implement in the future to make it more comprehensive.

Key Features

Frontend

  • Built with React & TypeScript: Ensures type safety and maintainable code.
  • Responsive Design with MUI: Provides a visually appealing interface across desktop and mobile devices.
  • State Management with Redux: Efficiently handles the global state across the application.
  • Theme Switching: Offers both dark and light modes for a customizable user experience.

Backend

  • C# and .NET 6: Provides a reliable backend framework for handling data and APIs.
  • EF Core with SQLite: Ensures efficient data storage and CRUD operations.
  • Real-Time Communication with WebSockets: Adds dynamic features for seamless updates.

Planned Features

While the current version of ReStore includes essential e-commerce functionalities, there are additional features I plan to incorporate:

  • User Authentication: Implementing a registration and login system for personalized user experiences. However, since I have already built a user authentication system in another project, I might reuse parts of that implementation instead of starting from scratch.
  • Order History and Tracking: Allowing users to view past orders and track current purchases.
  • Payment Integration: Adding secure payment gateways for seamless transactions.

These enhancements will further showcase my ability to create robust, full-featured web applications.

item.title: Concert Booking System: Simplifying Ticket Reservations
item.description:
Concert Booking System: Simplifying Ticket Reservations 🎟️

Project Overview

The Concert Booking System is a Java-based web service designed to simplify ticket reservations for concerts. Built with scalability and performance in mind, this project showcases my backend development skills, focusing on efficiency and reliability in high-demand scenarios such as concert ticket sales.

Features

  • Concert and Performer Information: Users can browse and explore details about concerts, performers, and schedules without logging in.
  • Interactive Seat Map: Visualize seat availability in real-time and reserve seats directly through the interface.
  • Secure Authentication: Users can log in with token-based authentication to view and manage their bookings securely.
  • Double-Booking Prevention: Ensures only one user can book a specific seat for a given concert at a time.

item.title: Games Web App: A Platform for Game Enthusiasts
item.description:
Games Web App: A Hub for Game Enthusiasts 🎮

Project Overview

The Games Web App is a Flask-based web application designed to create a seamless and engaging platform for game enthusiasts. Users can browse through a comprehensive catalog of games, view detailed information, leave reviews, and interact with other users through discussions and ratings.

This project focuses on providing a personalized user experience with features like authentication, game recommendations, and an interactive community hub. Its modular architecture ensures scalability and supports the addition of new features in the future.

Key Features

1. User Authentication

  • Secure login and registration system to ensure a personalized experience.
  • User profiles displaying their reviews, ratings, and activity history.

2. Game Catalog

  • Explore a wide variety of games, complete with descriptions, genres, release dates, and ratings.
  • Search and filter games by category, popularity, or user ratings.

3. Reviews and Ratings

  • Leave detailed reviews and rate games.
  • View community reviews and aggregate ratings to decide what to play next.

4. Discussion Forum

  • Engage in conversations with fellow gamers through a discussion board.
  • Start and participate in threads on game strategies, opinions, and news.

5. Personalized Recommendations

  • Receive game recommendations based on your activity, preferences, and ratings.

Technologies Used

Technology Purpose
Flask (Python) Backend framework for API development.
Jinja2 Template engine for rendering dynamic HTML.
SQLite Lightweight database for storing user, game, and review data.
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript Frontend design and interactive features.
Flask-WTF Form handling for user authentication and reviews.
Flask-Login Secure user authentication and session management.
SQLAlchemy ORM for database interaction.

Development Journey

1. Planning and Design

  • Researched user needs and similar platforms to identify features for the app.
  • Designed wireframes and drafted the database schema.

2. Backend Development

  • Implemented Flask routes for game browsing, reviews, and user authentication.
  • Used SQLAlchemy to manage database queries and relationships.

3. Frontend Development

  • Created dynamic pages using Jinja2 templates and styled them with CSS3.
  • Integrated JavaScript for interactive elements like search and filters.

4. Challenges and Solutions

  • Scalability: Designed the app with modular architecture to facilitate future feature additions.
  • Database Optimization: Implemented indices for frequent queries to improve performance.
  • User Authentication: Used Flask-Login and hashed passwords to ensure secure access.

Usage

Browse Games

  • View a catalog of games, search by genre, and filter by ratings.

Leave Reviews

  • Share your experience with a game by writing detailed reviews and rating it.

Join Discussions

  • Participate in threads to connect with like-minded gamers.

Demonstration

Here’s a short video showcasing the features and functionality of the Games Web App:

Planned Enhancements

  • Multiplayer Integration: Connect gamers based on mutual interests.
  • Achievements and Badges: Reward users for their activity, such as reviewing games or contributing to discussions.
  • Game Trailers: Embed video trailers for a more immersive browsing experience.
  • Mobile-Friendly Design: Make the app fully responsive for mobile users.

Acknowledgements

We would like to thank the following resources and communities for their guidance and support throughout the project:

  • Flask Documentation: Comprehensive reference for building web applications.
  • SQLite Documentation: Simplified database management for small-scale applications.
  • Open Game Data Sources: Provided initial game catalog information.
